item.title: History of Hindu Mahasabha
item.description: OUR PAST It spens superfluous to dwell on the achievements of the Hindus in the History of nations. Lord Curzon who cannot be accused of synpathy with Indian aspirations said in his address at the Delhi Durbar in 1901: “Powerful empires existed and flourished here, while the Englishmen were still wandering painted in the woods and while the British colonies were still a wilderness and a jungle. India has left a deeper park on the history, the philosophy and religion of mankind, than aty other terrestrial unit in the universe.
